body_content.explanation: the act of introducing something again as though it were something new, or an event at which this happens :
examples: The relaunch of the restaurant was an embarrassing flop.
The show will undergo a re-launch next year with a new presenter.

body_content.explanation: an occasion when a boat is put into the water again, or a spacecraft is sent into space again:
examples: A large crowd gathered to watch the relaunch of the liner.
The relaunch of the rocket was delayed because of bad weather.

body_content.explanation: to start again, or introduce something again as though it were something new:
examples: We need to come up with a better design before the website is relaunched.
The former pop star is planning to relaunch himself as an actor.
The show will relaunch early next year.

body_content.explanation: to put a boat into the water again, or send a spacecraft into space again:
examples: We needed six people to turn the vessel around and relaunch it.
At high tide we were finally able to relaunch the boat.
